cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles north of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest through the Bahamas, forecast to turn northwest toward the Florida peninsula and track up (or very near) the west coast of Florida toward the eastern Gulf of Mexico

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Bonita Beach to Anna Maria Island (west-central Florida coast, including Tampa Bay region)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, Bahamas, Turks & Caicos, north coast of Cuba, southeastern U.S. coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) increasingly likely Sunday night with a 74% cumulative chance; 50-kt winds have a 43% cumulative chance; hurricane-force winds (64 kt) cannot be ruled out (28% cumulative).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge of 3–5 ft possible in and near Tampa Bay if the track remains along or just offshore of the west coast of Florida, with higher levels in confined bays.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rainfall totals of 3–6 inches with locally up to 10 inches possible across west-central Florida, including the Tampa Bay area, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large battering waves and dangerous rip currents; possible port‐side coastal flooding; debris hazards from strong winds.
